text: Hi <@U1ENXTQRL>.  Depends on what you want to do.  If you deploy the simulated PoET in a public chain, the key is available to everyone.  In a private deployment you can use your own key and normal protections (e.g. file permissions) would keep the network secure.
The other option is to wrap the poet calls in a trusted compute environment.
Feel free to DM me with your project and I can give you more specific ideas.
Thank you <@U0VKPD6A2>. I'll certainly be writing you a message soon.
